head.title: Microsoft Preparing A Reply on Breakup

hedline.hl1: Microsoft Preparing A Reply on Breakup

block.p: On Wednesday, Microsoft must submit its reply to the government's proposal to split the company in two and offer its own suggested remedies in the antitrust case. On Wednesday, Microsoft must submit its reply to the government's proposal to split the company in two and offer its own suggested remedies in the antitrust case. Microsoft will not say precisely what its recommendations will be. But they are expected to consist mainly of proposals Microsoft has made repeatedly during settlement talks with the government over the last two years.

The steps have included allowing computer makers freedom to modify the Windows desktop screen and ensuring that rival software makers get equal access to information about the Windows operating system. In addition, according to people close to the talks, Microsoft has proposed curbing its own ability to enter into contracts with computer makers and Internet service providers that limit their ability to use and promote competing software.
